item.title: Continuous overspilling bins, 27th July
item.description:
These bins have been overspilling for years. The rubbish goes into gardens. The poor people that live opposite have to see this every time they leave their house. This is what it's like at least three times a week. It needs open bins and a cage.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ballance Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins overflowing with rubbish, 27th July
item.description:
The bins are constantly full and overflowing with rubbish and bags of dogs mess. There are rats and flies everywhere. It’s completely disgusting for residents. Move the bins or empty them frequently - I don’t care which. I’ve had enough!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Kelsey Park Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Terribly loud music from Wilton Estate Party., 27th July
item.description:
Hi, I live in Elrington road, and this terribly loud thumping music from the estate resident's party is penetrating to my house, giving me a headache. This noise is constantly going for hours!!! We received the note today that it will be from 2pm - 10pm!!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Graham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small fly tipping on corner of Peckarmans Wood, 27th July

item.title: Alll paving slabs moving, 27th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Macdonald Road, Friern Barnet, London

item.title: Abandoned car / smashed windscreen, 27th July
item.description:
EN60EPO - Ford Galaxy - parked on the corner of Venners Close, DA7 6SF. Smashed windscreen - no mot - not moved for over 8 months - weeds growing up and around the tyres. This eyesore needs to be removed. Young children play on the grass next to this car and this is a health and safety risk. Action needs to be taken for the removal of this eyesore which is making the street look run down.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Venners Close, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish corner increasing and spreading out, 27th July

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Common, Hackney, London
